inclusion.criterion: Women with singleton pregnancies of more than 28 weeks' gestation who were admitted to hospital with severe preeclampsia and candidates for vaginal delivery.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Persistent cerebral or visual disturbances or cerebral edema.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Systolic ≥160 mmHg or diastolic ≥110 mmHg on 2 occasions at least 6 h apart with the patient at bed rest.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Proteinuria of ≥5 g on 24-hour urine collection. Urine dipsticks are not accurate for this purpose.
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: polyhydramnios, previous uterine scar, chorioamnionitis and multiple pregnancies.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Hypertensive crisis the first drug used was hydralazine (5 mg IV every 15 minutes to a maximum total dose of 20 mg) and, if this was ineffective, Nifedipine (Epilat): 10 to 20 mg orally / 30 min (max 50 mg), Then 10-20 mg /4-6 h (max 120 mg/day) or labetalol (20 mg IV every 10 minutes to a maximum total dose of 300 mg).
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: The patients (60) were divided into two groups, Group A (30) received a single dose of carbetocin (100 μg in 1 mL ampoule, Pabal) while Group B (30) received misoprostol (600 μg, 3 tables) sublingually after the delivery of the anterior shoulder of the baby.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: The third stage of labour is managed as usual by clamping and cutting of umbilical cord, waiting for signs of placental separation and delivering the placenta by controlled cord traction.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: A 22-year-old Caucasian man came to the Clinic with a history of tremors since a year ago. Wilson disease was confirmed by high liver copper concentration (305 μg/g dry weight of liver).
